Part 3: Cylindrical hole along the vertical axis Create a cylindrical hole along the vertical axis of the prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles (180.0, 0.0, -90.0) and translation vector (0.1562, 0.75, 0.0313). Next, create a face (face\\_1) and draw a loop (loop\\_1) on it. The final shape will be a three-dimensional prism with a cylindrical hole along the vertical axis, and dimensions as mentioned in the description. The prism has a flat base and a flat top, and the cylindrical hole is centered along the vertical axis of the prism. On the same plane, create a new face. 2. Draw a circle with its center at the point (0.593, 0.1047) and a radius of 0.1047. Scale each 2D sketch by a factor of approximately 0.6977. Transform both scaled 2D sketches into 3D sketches using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0262, 0.0, 0.0349] Extrude each 3D sketch to generate the 3D models with these properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0698 - Sketch scale: 0.6977 - Operation: Cut materials from the previous part The dimensions of each cylindrical object in part 2 are: - Length: 0.6977 - Width: 0.0698 - Height: 0.6977 Combine all parts to obtain the final rectangular metal bracket with two holes on opposite sides. Perform a cut (CutFeatureOperation) to remove the material from the first part.</description>
